H0.text: Sample 1 has bands of light and dark crystals, which is the observation that most likely describes a sedimentary rock among the four rock samples observed by the student.

H1.text: Sample 2 has pink, gray, and white crystals grown together, which most likely describes a sedimentary rock observed by the student among the four rock samples.

H2.text: Sample 3 is made up of one huge, pale pink crystal, and this observation most likely describes a sedimentary rock based on the studentâ€™s observations of four rock samples.

H3.text: Sample 4 is made up of layers of sand grains cemented together, which most likely describes a sedimentary rock among the four rock samples observed by a student.

A4.text: Sedimentary rocks are formed by the cementation of sediments, which are particles made of minerals or organic matter deposited at Earth's surface.

A5.text: Sandstone is a type of clastic sedimentary rock composed primarily of sand grains.
